body.p: Maysville, Kentucky attorney. Alexandria, District of Columbia native. Married Asenath Throop Stanton in 1833. Father of Henry Thompson Stanton, Clarence T. Stanton, Asenath Stanton, Charlotte E. Stanton, Ella Stanton, Richard H. Stanton, and Maria Stanton. Attended Hallowell Academy. Moved to Kentucky in 1835. Independently studied law and admitted to the bar of Maysville in 1839. Editor of the Maysville Monitor from c1839 to 1841. Maysville Postmaster from 1845 to 1849. Served in the United States Congress from 1849 to 1855. Tenth Judicial District Commonwealth’s Attorney from 1857 to 1861. Compiled The Revised Statutes of Kentucky, Volume II, published in 1860. Arrested for disloyalty by General Nelson in October 1861 and released from custody in December 1861.
